units.title: Plate iPSCs on Matrigel-coated 24-well plate
units.text: While culturing human iPSCs, prepare a sterile 24-well plate and place sterile glass coverslips (12 mm diameter) onto the bottom of each well. Prepare at least six wells.
units.rationale: Establishes the initial substrate for iPSC attachment and downstream experiments.

units.title: Coat wells with Matrigel solution
units.text: Add 300 µl Matrigel/DMEM/F12 solution, described in the Reagent setup, per well of the 24-well plate. Incubate for 1 h at 37 °C and 5% CO2 in an incubator.
units.rationale: Creates a biologically relevant extracellular matrix for cell adhesion.

units.title: Fix organoids with 4% PFA
units.text: Add 1 ml of 4% PFA, prewarmed in a 37 °C water bath, and incubate the tube at RT for 30–60 min.
units.rationale: Preserves cellular architecture for downstream immunostaining.

units.title: Microinject CTB dye into optic vesicles
units.text: Fill glass capillary tip with 3 µl of CTB-488 dilution (front fill) and move the needle tip forward in front of the first pigmented area. Inject the solution into the first OV carefully, using a microscope.
units.rationale: Labels specific optic vesicle regions for tracing neuronal projections.

units.title: Isolate pigmented RPE aggregates
units.text: Collect darkly pigmented aggregates in a separate 15 ml centrifuge tube and centrifuge at 1,000g for 3 min at RT.
units.rationale: Enriches retinal pigment epithelium cells for subsequent culture.

units.title: Dissociate organoids for scRNA‑seq
units.text: Add 2 ml of Accutase containing 0.2 U/µl DNase I (prewarmed in a 37 °C water bath), close the tube tightly and incubate at 37 °C in a water bath.
units.rationale: Generates a single‑cell suspension required for single‑cell RNA sequencing.

units.title: Perform ERG light‑stimulus series
units.text: For dose‑dependent light sensitivity, expose each organoid to 500 ms long flashes. Start with a low intensity of 2,000 mlux (moonlight on a clear night), increase to 20,000 mlux (candle light) and then to 200,000 mlux (daylight on a cloudy day). Repeat each intensity three times at 3 min intervals, and then switch to the next higher light intensity.
units.rationale: Measures functional photoreceptor responses across a range of light intensities.

units.title: Induce neural differentiation and collect neurospheres (days 0–5)
units.text: In this protocol, we first induce neural differentiation (days 0–5) and collect neurospheres, which we culture in a neurosphere medium to initiate their patterning and further self‑assembly (days 5–10).
units.rationale: Begins the stepwise conversion of iPSCs into forebrain organoids with optic vesicles.

units.title: Transfer neurospheres to spinner flasks for organoid maturation
units.text: Then, upon transfer to spinner flasks containing OVB medium (days 10–30), neurospheres develop into forebrain organoids with one or two pigmented dots restricted to one pole, displaying forebrain entities of ventral and dorsal cortical progenitors and preoptic areas.
units.rationale: Promotes three‑dimensional growth and patterning of organoids in a dynamic culture environment.

units.title: Cryopreserve organoid sections for long‑term storage
units.text: Store slides for long‑term storage at 4 °C in the dark until microscopic analysis, either with a widefield, or if accessible, preferably with a confocal microscope.
units.rationale: Maintains sample integrity for future imaging and analysis.
